channel.title: Online Multiplayer Game + 3d Modeling?
channel.description:
I've taken an interest in the following (title) after watching a sort of documentary on Flight Simulator and how it has advanced and works.
Basically i just want to make a small Online Multi player thing, at first.. Just like a chat room but you can move around ;) What do you think is the best language to write this in? I have some knowledge of most languages, but am willing to learn a lot more.
After creating something small i want to gradually make it bigger. (No real reason, just satisfaction of accomplishment and fun)
Also, What do you suggest as a 3d Modeler?
Thanks.

item.title: Online Multiplayer Game + 3d Modeling?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:24, topic:80786”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=118672.msg1186783#msg1186783 date=1177103030]
Yeah the glory of java (ahhh lay luw ya! music)
But, i think YOU people could make something much better than runescape from scratch…
[/quote]

Runescape was coded in custom java library’s, for bad graphics on purpose. Wurmonline.com was made in java, some screenshots can be found here, here and the gallery can be found here.

Don’t quote me on this, but I recall the game using OpenGL, and those graphics look pretty damn impressive for any OS.[/quote]

Ok, Ok, maybe i was wrong but we could try?
(i’m gonna shut up now…)

Read full topic

item.title: Online Multiplayer Game + 3d Modeling?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:17, topic:80786”]Yeah the glory of java (ahhh lay luw ya! music)
But, i think YOU people could make something much better than runescape from scratch…[/quote]

Runescape was coded in custom java library’s, for bad graphics on purpose. Wurmonline.com was made in java, some screenshots can be found here, here and the gallery can be found here.

Don’t quote me on this, but I recall the game using OpenGL, and those graphics look pretty damn impressive for any OS.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Firion wrote:

To evryone saying there’s no such thing as a 3D Java Engine:

Yes there is, there totally is. jMonkeyEngine (with no relation to jme whatsoever)

http://www.jmonkeyengine.com/

item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:8, topic:80786”]I was really interested in making a small 3d game for some time, especially when jme_009 made one.

Maybe we could get a little project going with a few people?[/quote]

…Like some people from the graphics board… :O…

For the 3D Modeling… I find C4D Pretty damn easy ;)… It gives you a already simple shape of people and with a little bit of effort you could make it realistic enough :rolleyes:

So, yeh… xD

item.title: Online Multiplayer Game + 3d Modeling?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:14, topic:80786”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=118672.msg1185148#msg1185148 date=1177065111]

If you want to go as far as 3D graphics, then Java definitely won’t cut it. I’d recommend you use C++ and OpenGL. Of course, I’d imagine the learning curve is quite steep when graphics of any type are involved; so you’d need a genuine interest in the stuff to get somewhere.
[/quote]yea, because runescape isnt 3d, and there DEFINITELY ISNT A 3D API, IS THERE?! :\ dont be hatin’ for no reason

It’s not hating. I only use Java myself at the moment, having only played around with other stuff.

However, I’m well aware of its limitations. You should be too. I was assuming that when he said 3D that he meant 3D as in what’s found on Xbox 360 or playstation 3 games.[/quote]
Oh god, no. For 3d Modeling i wasn’t quite planning on placing it in any game, i just wanted to experiment and create some landscapes, characters, ect.

Read full topic

item.title: Online Multiplayer Game + 3d Modeling?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:13, topic:80786”][quote author=lothy link=topic=118672.msg1185021#msg1185021 date=1177062047]
If you want to go as far as 3D graphics, then Java definitely won’t cut it. I’d recommend you use C++ and OpenGL. Of course, I’d imagine the learning curve is quite steep when graphics of any type are involved; so you’d need a genuine interest in the stuff to get somewhere.
[/quote]yea, because runescape isnt 3d, and there DEFINITELY ISNT A 3D API, IS THERE?! :\ dont be hatin’ for no reason[/quote]
It’s not hating. I only use Java myself at the moment, having only played around with other stuff.

However, I’m well aware of its limitations. You should be too. I was assuming that when he said 3D that he meant 3D as in what’s found on Xbox 360 or playstation 3 games.

Read full topic
